com.netflix.genie.core.services

Interface ClusterLoadBalancer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    org.springframework.core.Ordered
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    RandomizedClusterLoadBalancerImpl, ScriptLoadBalancer

    @Validated
public interface ClusterLoadBalancer
extends org.springframework.core.Ordered
    Interface for the cluster load-balancer, which returns the "best" cluster to run job on from an array of candidates.
    Since:
    2.0.0

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_ORDER
      The default order to apply to any implementation that doesn't explicitly set one.

      • Fields inherited from interface org.springframework.core.Ordered

        HIGHEST_PRECEDENCE, LOWEST_PRECEDENCE

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default int getOrder()
      Cluster selectCluster(java.util.Set<Cluster> clusters, JobRequest jobRequest)
      Return best cluster to run job on.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_ORDER

        static final int DEFAULT_ORDER
        The default order to apply to any implementation that doesn't explicitly set one.
        See Also:
        Ordered, OrderComparator, Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • selectCluster

        @Nullable
Cluster selectCluster(@Nonnull @NonNull @NotEmpty
                                java.util.Set<Cluster> clusters,
                                @Nonnull @NonNull
                                JobRequest jobRequest)
                         throws GenieException
        Return best cluster to run job on.
        Parameters:
        clusters - An immutable, non-empty list of available clusters to choose from
        jobRequest - The job request these clusters are being load balanced for
        Returns:
        the "best" cluster to run job on or null if no cluster selected
        Throws:
        GenieException - if there is any error

        default int getOrder()
